intro: Glaucium refractocarpum subsp. erectocarpum, commonly known as the upright-fruited gloryflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive blue-green foliage and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces capsule fruits that are upright and elongated, giving it its subspecies name. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and unique morphology, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
